intro: Lupinus brandegeei, commonly known as the Brandegge lupine, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect growth habit and clusters of pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several small, oval-shaped leaflets. Lupinus brandegeei plays a role in soil stabilization and provides nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
